_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies
    We at the Rock Island wastewater Treatment Plant are committed to a safe working environment for employees, community, and the environment. Procedures and equipment have been reviewed to ensure that the chlorine process is as safe as possible. If, for some inforeseeable reason there were a chlorine gas release, we are coordinated with the Rock Island Fire department.

2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled.
   We have 1 regulated substance, which is CHLORINE. The maximum inventory of chlorine stored at our facility is 6000 lbs.

3. The Worst Case Release Scenario and Alternative Release Scenario
   To perform the OCA we used the look-up tables and equations provide by the EPA.

Toxic Worst Case analysis:
   The worst Case scenario involves a catastrophic release of chlorine gas from a ruptured tank. The release rate would be 200 lbs/min for a total of 2000 lbs of chlorine gas. The distance to end point is 5.4 miles and the affected population is 159,814.
Toxic Alternative analysis:
   The Alternative scenario involves a release of chlorine gas from a broken valve at a rate of 0.33 lbs/min for a total of 200 lbs. The distance to end point is 0.08 miles and the affected population is 0.

Flammable Worst Case analysis:
   None applicable

Flammable Alternative analysis:
   None applicable

4. General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention steps.
    Our facility has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements of 40 CFR part 68. Our process is suject to the OSHA PSM standard.

Process Safety Information:
   The Rock Island wastewater plant maintains records of safety imformation, chemical hazards, operating procedures, and equipment design info. 
Process Hazard Analysis:
    Our facility conducts a PHA with a team of employees using the "What-if" methodology at 5 year intervals. Any findings are addre

ssed in a timely manner.
Operating Procedures:
   The Plant maintains specific operating procedures for the chloination process. The information is regularly reviewed and updated. Operating personnel are actively involved in the process.
Training:
    We conduct safety training on the CHLORINE every year. New emloyees receive class room and On-the-job training. The Plant supervisor and other operators observe new personnel to determine competience.
Mechanical Integrity:
   The plant maintenance personnel carry out an extensive Preventive Maintenance Program. All work is documented. Any deficiencies are repaired in a timelt manner.
Management of Change:
   Written policies are in place for management of change in porcesses. All personnel are notified of any changes.
Pre-Start Up Reviews:
    Pre-start up reviews are conducted for all new processes and equipment.
Compliance Audits:
    Compliance audits are conducted on a regular basis to determine whether the RMP rules and regulations are being met. Results of the audits are implemented in a prompt manner,
Incident Investigation:
     We promptly investigate any and all accidents and incidents. All information is documented. Al accidents are reviewed by a team to determine whether they were preventable or not and suggest corrective actions.
Employee Participation:
    We do believe in employee participation in process safety. Employees are strongly encouraged to express concerns and suggestions.
Contractors:
  On the rare occassions when we do hire contractors, we always hold Pre-construction meetings. Safet and current processes are always a part of that meeting agenda.

5.  Five-year Accident History:
    The  Rock Island Wastewater Plant has had an excellent record of safety. There have not been any accidents or incidnets with the CHLORINE process.

6. Emergency Response Plan:
    The facility is included in the written community ER Plan. The local agency coordinating the ER Plan is the Rock Island Fire Department

, which has a phone number of 309-732-2800   ( or 911)

7. Planned Changes to Improve safety:
    There are currently no planned changes to improve safety.
